briefTitle: To Evaluate Sarilumab - SAR153191 (REGN88) - Auto-injector Device In Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open-Label, Parallel-Group Usability Study Of The Sarilumab Auto-Injector Device And A Prefilled Syringe In Patients With Moderate To Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis Who Are Candidates For Anti-IL6R Therapy
summary:
Primary Objective:

To collect real-use data of the sarilumab auto-injector device (AID) used by rheumatoid arthritis (RA) participants.

Secondary Objective:

To compare the pharmacokinetic (PK) exposure of sarilumab administered by AID versus prefilled syringes (PFS).

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Validated AID Associated Product Technical Failures (PTFs)

effectByArm.arm: Sarilumab 150 mg by AID (AID Assessment Phase)
Sarilumab 200 mg by AID (AID Assessment Phase)
